Node.Text: Lobby.
Are you alright?
Ha... do you even care? I'm just a suspect of your investigation, after all.
What has you so upset?
You don't deserve to know.
That's all. Have a good night, operator.
I do care for your safety. You're a resident here, and you're entitled to feeling secure.
I... thank you, it means a lot to hear someone say that.
If I'm being honest, no. I'm not. But I can't hide in the shadows forever.
Tell me honestly, operator... do you think that I killed Alex?
I don't know.
...I don't think I did, but I can't convince you of that, can I? I can't even convince myself.
When I was still a soldier, I made a mistake that cost the lives of the rest of my team. I still hold the guilt to this day.
Whether it's here or on the battlefield, it doesn't seem to matter. Death follows me everywhere I go.
Node.Hint: Is this an admission of guilt?

Node.Text: Well, I guess it's time for me to go. Have a good night.
Yes.
Alright. Good night, then.
No, I'm not. I'm terrified, and I'm worried that I may have caused Alex's death.
Is that a confession?
I don't know anymore.
Node.Hint: Thomas did not agree, nor did he disagree with the accusation.

Node.Text: I should go to bed. Night.
Why do you say that?
I told everyone that I was suspicious of her, but she didn't deserve this! What if I convinced someone to kill her? What if it's all my fault?
(say nothing)
...I should go. Goodnight.
There's no way you could have known this would happen.
I appreciate your faith in me, but I should have known. It's just like my last battle when I was a soldier.
Me and my team, we were on a mission that required absolute stealth. I hit something and made a sound... next thing I knew, I was in the hospital, and they...
...they were all dead. Living was my karma. I still hold that guilt with me every day, and just when I thought I was moving past it, the murders started.
But, see, what they don't tell you is that living is harder than dying. Because the fallen get to watch from their graves, and their families get to cry for their sons who will never come home.
...Anyway, that's all in the past. What matters now is stopping the monster that has it out for us all.
Thank you for listening to me. Sorry for using so much of your time. Have a good night, and please stay safe.
